meanings.definition: Not currently holding a particular position or office.
meanings.sent1: The nonincumbent candidate promised to bring fresh ideas to the campaign.
meanings.sent2: It is important to consider the nonincumbent perspective when making decisions.
meanings.sent3: The nonincumbent squirrel tried to steal the acorns from the usual storage spot.
meanings.sent4: Her nonincumbent approach to problem-solving impressed the entire team.
meanings.sent5: The nonincumbent flowers in the garden added a vibrant touch to the landscape.

meanings.definition: A person who is not currently in office.
meanings.sent1: The nonincumbent quickly adapted to the responsibilities of the new role.
meanings.sent2: As a nonincumbent, he had to work harder to gain the trust of the voters.
meanings.sent3: The nonincumbent at the meeting had a unique perspective on the issue.
meanings.sent4: She stood out as a nonincumbent with her innovative proposals.
meanings.sent5: The nonincumbent brought a fresh energy to the team with their enthusiasm.
